#Text=Datar Kaur
#Text=Rani Datar Kaur
#Text=( died on 20 June 1818 ) , the daughter of Sardar Ran Singh Nakai , the third ruler of Nakai Misl of Baherwal , was the 2nd wife of Maharaja Ranjit Singh .
#Text=The arranged marriage nuptials took place in 1798 at Baherwal Kalan .
#Text=Originally named Raj Kaur , she changed her name to Datar Kaur as Raj Kaur was also the name of Ranjit Singh 's mother .
#Text=Maharaja lovingly addressed her as Mai Nakain .
#Text=In 1802 , she gave birth to Kharak Singh , the heir apparent of Ranjit Singh .
#Text=She took an active interest in the affairs of the State .
#Text=She died on 20 June 1818 .
#Text=Her grandson was Maharaja Nau Nihal Singh ( 1821 – 1840 ) .
#Text=Yes
#Text=Family History
#Text=Bibi Raj Kaur
#Text=was the youngest of four siblings .
#Text=She had three brothers ; Bhagwan Singh , Gyan Singh and Khazan Singh .
#Text=Their father , Sardar Ran Singh Nakai , the third ruler of Nakai Misl , had fought repeatedly against Kamar Singh , the ruler of Sayyadwala .
#Text=Sometime before his death in 1781 , he defeated him and captured Sayyadwala .
#Text=Sardar Ran Singh had greatly expanded his Misl 's strength so it became dominant among its neighbours .
#Text=At its high point under Ran Singh it ruled Kasur , Sharakpur , Gugera pargana , and the Kharral fort of Kot Kumaliah .
#Text=His son , Bhagwan Singh , succeeded him but could not hold his territory against Wazir Singh , the brother of Kamar Singh who retook Sayyadwala .

#Text=Realizing he might lose all of his territory , around 1784 , Bhagwan Singh set up the engagement of his sister , Raj Kaur , to Ranjit Singh , who was the son of Mahan Singh , the leader of the powerful Sukerchakkia Misl , in order to gain a powerful ally .
#Text=Bhagwan Singh and Wazir Singh continued to engage in constant warfare and Bhagwan Singh was killed in battle .
#Text=In 1789 , Gyan Singh , the second son of Sardar Ran Singh Nakai , succeeded his brother , and in 1798 , married his sister Raj Kaur to Ranjit Singh .
#Text=Raj Kaur also being the name of a mother of Maharaja Ranjit Singh , she took the name of Datar Kaur .
#Text=In some historical accounts , mistakenly , marriage of Ranjit Singh has been mentioned with two daughters of Nakai Misl i.e. Raj Kaur and Datar Kaur .
#Text=However , she was one and the same person .
#Text=In 1802 , she gave birth to Prince Kharak Singh , the heir apparent of Sikh Empire .
#Text=Even though Ranjit Singh had many marriages , Datar Kaur remained his favourite and he fondly called her Mai Nakain .
#Text=In 1807 , Gyan Singh died and his son Sardar Kahan Singh Nakai succeeded him .
#Text=Sukerchakkia/Nakai Relationship
#Text=Even though his favourite Rani was from the house of the Nakais , the relationship between Sukerchakkias and Nakais remained an uneasy one .
#Text=After Ranjit Singh had declared himself a Maharaja in 1801 after consolidating majority of the Misls , this ambitious chief had been eyeing the Nakai territory .
#Text=He spared it till the death of Gyan Singh in 1807 , but soon after suggested Kahan Singh to join the Darbar at Lahore , which the proud Nakai chief steadily refused .
#Text=Finally , in 1810 , Ranjit Singh sacked Kahan Singh and annexed all the Nakai territories .
#Text=Even the Rani could not prevent it .
